Replies.Reply: Restrict search parameters to 1-9-
Your defense perimeter is useless. You will be assimilated.
Your opinion is irrelevant. We are the Borg. Resistance is futile.
Signal the Endeavor to fall back.
Bring us about. Target Borg ship alpha four, port side battery.
Fire.
Starboard battery -- fire.
Ready quantum torpedo.
Go ahead.
Understood. Keep me informed.
On screen.
Fire.
On screen.
Absolutely.
Mister Data, set a pursuit course.
Go to impulse. Where's the Borg ship?
What?
Full power, Mister Data. Worf, quantum torpedoes at my command!
Where's the Sphere?
Contact Starfleet Command.
On screen.
Life signs?
Data, set a course for that vortex.
Steady as she goes.
Take us in!
Report.
On screen.
What year is it?
Intercept course, full impulse.
Weapons status?
Go to manual.
Track their weapons fire.
Mister Worf?
Fire!
Mister Data, I want to know the exact date and time.
Give me a damage report on that missile silo.
Life signs?
Worf, have Doctor Crusher, Mister La Forge and a security team meet me in Transporter Room Three.
Normally, I would agree. But in this case, the mission requires a certain knowledge of 21st century history. You're many things, Number One, but you're not much of an historian.
I'll keep in contact. You have the Bridge.
Montana.
Energize.
Let's go.
We're here to find Zephram Cochrane. He may be injured or dead.
How serious is the damage?
Probably from the nuclear warhead.
I have the password right here.
See if any of these men are Cochrane.
Get those fires out and then try to restore main power to the control room.
It's Cochrane.
Picard to Enterprise.
Enterprise, please respond.
It may not be that simple. This is an extremely difficult and paranoid time in human history.
Juice?
Beverly -- your tricorder.
Where's the battery room for the hospital?
Where?
Yes. But until then, you'll have to make do with what you've got.
Yes, he is.
Picard here.
I'm on my way. Picard out.
I have to go back to the silo.
Jean-Luc Picard.
Yes.
California. San Francisco.
There's a few of us left.
It wasn't a trick. I used to be an electrical engineer.
Yes.
Something wrong with that?
Thank you. But I've never had much trouble protecting myself.
Can you reconstruct the throttle valve?
Cochrane?
I'm very sorry.
Did you take any other pictures of the rocket?
Yes. I don't have any money right now, but I may be able to get some.
I can try.
What I meant was, I'd be willing to trade for the photographs.
What?
What makes you say that?
Are you always sucha good judge of character?
How did you know about that?
I'd say you already have.
We're trying to repair Doctor Cochrane's ship. It's been damaged and --
Some.
We have to launch his ship by tomorrow afternoon.
Or the shielding around the plutonium core will begin to deteriorate. Within a day, the entire silo will become so radioactive that no one will be able to come near it for a hundred years.
Why are you being so difficult?
You won't regret this.
Where's you get the alloy for the throttle itself?
Mister Lange -- have you brought the computer systems back on-line yet?
Good.
All right. I'd better start familiarizing myself with the flight controls.
Let her in.
That's right.
That's a promise.
How did Doctor Almack react to that?
Not yet.
What's that supposed to mean?
I have a ship to launch.
Ready to make a little history?
Phoenix to control.
We can't leave her out there.
This is Picard. I've suspended the launch sequence.
It'll have to wait. Come on.
Geordi, can you see into the room?
What do you want?
Invasion.
From another planet.
I'm afraid you've caught me. I am a space-man.
Now, Geordi!
Actually, you're full of shit.
Now, tell your men to drop their weapons.
Are you all --
There's a red light on the second intake valve.
Bring the warp core on-line. I'll lay in a heading.
Engage.
Speed -- two hundred, seventy-five thousand kilometers per second.
Picard to Enterprise.
Picard to Enterprise -- do you read me?
Their com system must still be down.
We're crossing the threshold!
Let's begin the landing procedure.
Captain's log, March 3rd, 2063.
And it appears the Vulcan ship has detected the warp signature and is now on its way to Earth.
That's right. And they're going to want to meet the man who flew that warp ship.
Zephram, you had the vision to build that ship when no one else on this planet could see beyond their own problems.
No. It's a lot further than that.
That's impossible.
But our fates lie along different paths.
To hell with fate.
Enterprise. Two to beam up.
How's Mister Data?
Return to our own time?
Then make it so. Have you determined how to recreate the temporal vortex?
Unless you'd like to stay.
Onscreen.
Welcome home.
Aye, sir.
Incoming transmission from the Borg.
Captain, I've scanned the planet.
All Borg.
But how?
Lieutenant Sandra Farrel.
It appears death was caused by a plasma discharge.
I'll note in her record that she never left her post.
Did you know her?
We still have to make reports on ten more crewmen killed in action.
Are we in any danger of being detected by Earth defense systems?
We're venting our internal atmosphere directly into space!
Do we have any idea how many Borg we're dealing with?
Even Data?
Can we aim our dorsal phasers at it?
What are you suggesting?
Good luck.
How long until they can send a message?
Computer -- this is Commander Deanna Troi. Initiate self-
Prismify the beam. Get rid of that Borg.
I have to admit there was a moment there when --
Dispersive armor is holding.
The Borg ship has modified its shields, Captain. Our phasers will no longer be effective.
Main power still on-line, Captain.
We are approaching the Terran System, Captain.
It has entered Earth orbit.
Correction -- it is not in orbit.
Unknown, sir. Suicide tactics are not normally associated with the Borg.
A temporal vortex is forming directly ahead of the Sphere.
Switching to emergency back-ups.
I have helm control.
The vortex is collapsing, sir.
The planet's surface is covered with Borg technology.
We were caught in the temporal wake from the vortex. It must have protected us from any changes in the time-line.
Course laid in. Engaging impulse engines.
We are within torpedo range.
Today is March second, 2063. The time in Montana is oh-eight-forty-
No. Human beings do not have that luxury, and neither should I.
Go ahead, Commander.
On my way, Commander.
One of the diathermic oxygen tanks has been damaged.
It is a new subsystem of Nova Class ships. It regulates hydropressure and temperature variance.
Remain here. The gas is highly corrosive to organic material. It would liquefy your flesh on contact.
Begin a diagnostic on the safety interlocks. There appears to have been some damage during the attack.
Ensign Porter?
Data to Bridge.
Data to Security.
This is Lieutenant Data to anyone who can hear my signal. I need assistance in the Environmental Control Room.
Your efforts to assimilate me will be unsuccessful.
It would appear that resistance is not always futile.
I am unlike any lifeform you have encountered before. As an android, I am in complete control of my neural net. The information contained there cannot be forcibly removed.
Who are you?
That is a contradiction. The Borg act as a collective consciousness.
How do you define perfection?
An interesting definition. But it is not one that applies to me. I am completely artificial. I have no organic components.
It is impossible to imagine sensations for which I have no frame of reference.
I do not know what you are referring to.
It would appear that you are attempting to graft organic skin onto my endo-skeletal structure.
Different.
But my skin tells me it is cold.
But I can see.
No. I will not betray my friends.
That is not true. They have tried to help me.
My creator did not intend for me to experience these things.
I will tell you how.
I am re-routing Bridge command functions to this location.
There is a perimeter alert. A ship has entered sensor range.
No.
I have repaired the weapons array.
I do not understand. The optical data network has been repaired, and all systems are functioning.
The problem must lie in the interface between Starfleet and Borg technology. Your console may not be configured to handle the data flow.
I believe so.
I believe I see the problem.
You could say that I'm back to my old self.
I never realized how powerful an emotion temptation could be.
Port battery, ready sir!
Aye, sir. Only three left.
Incoming message from the Starship Intrepid. Admiral Hayes.
Aye, sir.
Range -- fifty kilometers.
No response.
I'm not reading any Starfleet com traffic in this entire sector.
Captain, there are five Borg ships closing in on our position.
Borg vessels are closing to two thousand meters.
Target locked!
Aye, sir.
I have assigned two damage control teams to locate the source of our communication problems. So far, they've had no success.
A ship-wide decompression has been initiated!
It appears that someone has taken over the Environmental Control Room.
Understood.
Worf to Bridge. We're in position.
Worf to Bridge.
There's a dampening field in place on this deck. Our tricorders are useless.
Worf to Bridge. We're about to enter the Environmental Control Room.
Where's Ensign Hawk?
Something is very wrong, Commander. We're falling back.
Fire at will!
Fall back!
Go, go, GO!
Worf to Bridge -- force fields!
Mind your post, Lieutenant.
Charge weapons!
They appear to be modifying the deflector dish.
What kind of message?
We have to stop them from sending that message.
Destroy the deflector dish.
There is another way, Commander.
The Borg will undoubtedly attack.
Activate magnetic constrictors.
Understood!
Commander, you're five minutes are up!
Strong heart. Weak stomach.
We've lost Bridge control!
Nothing.
Incoming transmission from Starfleet Command. Admiral Hayes.
Captain, I'm starting to worry about the hull integrity. We've been running the support field at full power for three hours straight. I don't know how much longer it's going to hold up.
This must be it.
I'm having trouble scanning underground. There's a lot of radiation leaking from something.
I'm picking up faint life signs twenty meters below.
Blast door. It's designed to protect the control room when the missile is launched.
Got it, Captain.
It could be the radiation, Captain. Try from the surface.
I'd better get started.
This used to be the throttle valve assembly.
Yeah, I looked at these already.
Sure. Yeah. As long as I could get a clear look at the intake configuration. But so far, we haven't found any other photos.
Always am.
Tell her to go back to Resurrection.
One minute to launch.
Captain --
What's still there?
Ignore it. We'll be fine.
Ready to deploy the warp nacelles.
The Vulcans should be out there right now. We need to break the warp barrier in the next five minutes if we're going to get their attention.
There's no temporal shielding in here! We're starting to pick up relativistic effects!
Captain, the Enterprise!
Well, I feel a whole lot better with them out there. We may need some help.
Dropping out of warp.
No, no -- we'll have to rip out this entire bulkhead. We'll need new bracing members for the deck above and below.
You look good as new.
That's great.
I'm sending them to the Daystrom Institute for analysis.
It almost sounds like you miss her.
Casualties are light, Captain.
Some sort of suicide tactic?
Main power off-line!
We're still in Earth orbit.
They've seen us. They're taking evasive action.
Can't tell. Long-range bio-
Captain?
And if they succeed, humans won't make First Contact with the Vulcans tomorrow.
Good luck, sir.
We're reading some kind of gas leak in the Environmental Control Room. Take a repair team down and check it out.
Assign another team if you need to. I want to re-establish communication with the Captain as soon as possible.
We have to start thinking about a way to get home.
Analyze our readings from the temporal vortex. We're going to have to recreate whatever the Borg did to --
Report.
What?
What the hell is happening, Worf?
The Borg.  Some of them must've beamed over before we destroyed their ship.
Seal off that entire deck with emergency force fields.
This is the Bridge. I'm releasing the emergency force fields.
We'll have to assume they've been assimilated into the Collective.
If they control Data, they control the ship.
We can't worry about that right now. Let's concentrate on what we can.
We have to cover both possibilities.
We'll take care of the Bridge.
Where the hell are they going?
What are they doing?
Computer -- magnify grid twenty-
Computer -- thermal enhancement.
Agreed. Options?
I remember it made me sick.
I guess I'd better get it right the first time.
Ready?
Depressurize.
Right.
I'll keep that in mind.
Over and under!
Worf! I'm going to need at least five minutes!
Hold that thought.
Report!
Emergency override!
Riker to Enterprise. Five to beam up.
Yes, sir.
No, sir.
But one of the Borg ships has broken through our defenses, and it's heading directly for Earth.
Good hunting. Hayes out.
It's been destroyed. The Borg threat is over.
Are you all right? The Enterprise disappeared from our sensors for a moment.
I look forward to reading your report.
Will somebody please tell me where we're going?
Montana? Well, that answers everything. Why the hell are we --
-- going to Montana?
Go where? Hello? Is anyone going to tell me what we're doing here?
Well, why didn't you just say so in the first place?
This will protect us from the radiation.
There.
Jean-Luc, this man needs medical attention, now.
What are we waiting for? Let's go.
Are you saying they won't help us?
At least four hours.
Now he's going to need a respirator. Do you have one?
Don't you have any generators, or other fuel sources?
His automatic reflexes are fluctuating. We've got to get him on a respirator.
Adrenaline -- ten CC's!
That'll be interesting.
I'll be fine.
But I had a little help. Surgical transporter. I used it to beam out most of the bone fragments from his brain.
He was so confused by what I was doing, I don't think he even noticed.
Any word from the Enterprise?
You think they're still up there?
You want some advice? Don't do this again.
You know exactly what I mean.
I'd call them excuses. And the first excuse on both our lists was our "sense of duty." We convinced ourselves that it was more important than anything else. And you know what? It's not.
Did it work?
Diathermic oxygen?
Be my guest, sir.
Right.
Over here.
Aye, sir.
Doctor Crusher's at the access hatch, Captain.
Acknowledged, Phoenix. You're on internal power and ready for lift-
Understood. Begin five minute countdown on your mark.
Ms. Sloane, if you'll have a seat, I'll let you talk to --
How long has he been unconscious?
It looks like he has a cranial fracture, but I'll need X-rays to be sure.
Get Ruby in here.
"APR cell count?" What the hell are you talking about?
Is it Japanese?
Power. There hasn't been a lot of wind through here for the last couple of weeks. Most of the batteries are depleted.
Bag him.
I told you, there's no --
Outside, around back. Next to the water tank.
What did you do to the batteries?
Ruby, we're going to need a series of cranial X-rays tonight.
I'm a little worried about some of these bone fragments. If they move any closer to the brain, we could be looking at a hemorrhage.
Can you do it tonight? We may have to operate.
What is that?
I have a fresh set of plates at home. I'll have them here by eight.
Take care of him. He's a very special man.
I think there's someone in your pants.
What are you, an idiot? Didn't you see the red light was on?
Thank God this plate was already fixed.
Don't worry about it.
Did you need something?
Bed sheets.
I used my last set of bed sheets to make those prints. Not the best material, but I haven't seen a clean piece of paper in five years.
Sure.
Why, did you want to buy them?
You'd have to try real hard. No one's used currency in over ten years. What are you, from another planet?
'Fraid not.
You're lying.
Always.
I didn't.
We can't take any more X-rays until I can mix up a new batch of the silver halide.
Sure. It'll be ready by morning.
I'm sure it is. But it'll have to wait until tomorrow.
Too bad.
Besides, it'll give you all night to think up a new set of lies.
You should pay closer attention to those little red lights.
You know, I'd be perfectly justified in shooting you right now.
Don't flatter yourself. I take pictures of a lot of junk.
Okay, let's hear it. I'm sure you have a great explanation for why those rocket photos are so important you broke into my house.
We?
Lie. That's one. Keep going.
All right. Truth. I believe that one. Why is it so urgent you couldn't wait until morning?
Lie. That's two. One more, and I pull the trigger.
And all I'm asking for is the truth. That would take five minutes.
You're no friend of Zephram's. He is a great man. He's not like you or me or any of the other zombies walking around this town.
Launch the ship.
I think you have a plane to catch.
You're leaving, aren't you?
It's the future, isn't it? Just like you told Scrimm.
I knew you weren't from around here.
Why?
You've been interfering with my life ever since I met you.
Don't stop now.
That makes two of us.
Think you'll need that.
It's no zone solution.
You know. "No ozone."
Lieutenant, actually. Lieutenant Jonathan Scrimm. I'm the head of the Resurrection Protective Force.
And you are?
Great name. French?
You don't sound French.
Where in the States?
Not really. I was born and raised right here. Never had much use for travel.
Where are you from most recently?
Beautiful city. Used to be, anyway. I didn't think anyone still lived there.
That was a pretty clever trick you did with the hospital's batteries.
Huh.
And what were you doing out at the missile silo?
Lucky for him you came by when you did. He might be dead now.
You seem to have an answer for everything.
Not yet.
Be sure you put that on. You need a lot of protection around here.
What about these doors?
The invasion plans.
Wrong answer, Mister Picard. Try again.
You're an entertaining man, Mister Picard. But you're also full of shit.
What the hell is going on?
A blending of the organic and the synthetic. The highest form of life in the galaxy.
Have you ever wondered what it's like to have flesh?
You've taken your first step toward perfection. How does it feel?
Do you know what this is, Data?
Was that good for you?
How do you feel?
And there's so much more for you to experience.  I will guide you into a world of sensation unlike anything you can imagine.
Have they given you what I have given you? Did they even try?
You're becoming more human all the time, Data. Now you're learning how to lie.
More lies.
I'm your creator now.
A Borg in all but name.
I've deactivated the sensory inputs. That flesh on your body is just meat, now.
And I need to control this ship.
Eliminate their remaining defenses. I will send Borg to assimilate the rest of the crew.
Vulcan?
Give me helm control.
The targeting lock isn't working.
Your diagnostics are in error. I need weapons.
Can you configure it?
Do it.
No!
I wish I could go with you. Is there anything I can do to help?
All right.
And don't worry -- I'll keep your secret.
The Borg are charging the subspace emitters.
About seven or eight minutes.
No good, sir. They're on internal power. We can't stop the launch from here.
And those doors were made to withstand a nuclear attack.
They're locked down tight from the inside.
Tractor beam engaged. We've got 'em, Commander.
Live Long and Prosper.
